page.title: 11Steyning Court
page.content: The building where the courts stand was built in 1883, but was converted into a court in 1960.It was going to be in Shoreham but there was a fault at the site and the building at Steyning was for sale. On average the court gets{Â£3/4 millon pounds}a year in fines. The court is down Bank Passage in the High Street, it is open {Mon -Thur.}The court handles{15,000 cases a year.There are three different courts in the building. The smallest is called the cupboard. The area the court covers is; Steyning, Horsham, Fishers Gate, Henfield, Lancing, Sompting, Southwick and Storrington.The population of this area is{93,480}people.The worst case they've had was 3 murders. The difference between a Crown Court and a Magistrate's is a Crown Court has a Judge and Jury.
